newsitem.title: USA: Fire extinguished at Houston fuel oil terminal.
newsitem.headline: Fire extinguished at Houston fuel oil terminal.

text.p: Firefighters extinguished a fire in a fuel storage tank at the Houston Fuel Oil Terminal Co facility along the Houston Ship Channel on Thursday, officials said.
The explosion and fire, which witnesses said sent flames shooting 100 feet into the air, did not spread to adjacent tanks and was quickly contained and put out, officials said.
Details were not immediately available on the volume of fuel oil that had been stored in the tank. Officials with the U.S. Coast Guard and local fire department were investigating the incident.
